result.execSummary:
The defendant Eugene A Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Defendant Eugene A Williams in court, in custody.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Eugene A Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 
Amended information filed. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - NO CONTEST. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY.
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defense requests expungement. 

BTC: 58 days CREDIT FOR TIME SERVED concurrent. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, costs reduced to judgment. 

Court denies expungement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
LTR - requesting plea and sentencing hearing

8:34 AM Defendant Eugene A Williams in court, in custody.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Eugene A Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Defense indicates they have an offer but are still waiting on some discovery, requests another status. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

8:52 AM Defendant Eugene A Williams in court, in custody.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Eugene A Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: State's NOI to Introduce Certd Public Records
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the co-defendant. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:10 PM Defendant Eugene A Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn appeared by video for Eugene A Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
